channel.title: Teleports
channel.description: Okay. Seeing as I cannot get my normal teleports to work. How would I make emote teleports?

item.title: Teleports
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Well, since you have teleports on them already, it will be very easy.
Click one of the teleports, and type ::mypos.
Get the X coordinate, and search it in your client class.
You can work on it from there.

Read full topic

item.title: Teleports
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

[quote="_Reforced, post:10, topic:262228"][quote author=Setsuna link=topic=346306.msg2668023#msg2668023 date=1234677639]
The emote’s have teleports on them atm…I just want to change them. And they don’t have ID’s…
[/quote]

They would have to have IDs, there is no other way they can be identified.[/quote]

Well, I mean I do not know the ID’s and when I scroll over them with my mouse it does not show them…

Read full topic

item.title: Teleports
item.dc:creator: @Reforced _Reforced
item.description:
@Reforced wrote:

Setsuna:

No clickingmost file. So I’m guessing they’re in the client.

Okay, then find case 185, and get the IDs of the emotes. Or as an easier way to debug the IDs, add this to case 185.

sendMessage("Action button ID: "+actionButtonId+".");

This will tell you what the ID of that button is, whenever you want to add a new ID, you would add a new case under the switch statement. As an example…

case 1: teleportToX = *; teleportToY = *; break;

Now replace the one with the emote button ID and the * with your desired coordinates.

Read full topic

item.title: Teleports
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Setsuna, post:5, topic:262228”]No clickingmost file. So I’m guessing they’re in the client.[/quote]Okay, in packet 85 (case 85:) in your client there will be a switch statement. By using the switch statement, you’re going to use an action button ID as a case number. Look under case 85 and you’ll see that switch. Normally, if you click anything on your game client it will outrpint an Action Button ID in your run.cmd that isn’t already put in the switch statement.

All of that might be confusing if you have no clue what im talking about, and I’m assuming you don’t, so tell me; do you have teleport tabs already in the server?

Read full topic
